thread.title: Britain’s Angus Deaton wins Nobel economics prize
thread.title_full: Britain’s Angus Deaton wins Nobel economics prize | Toronto Star

title: Britain’s Angus Deaton wins Nobel economics prize
text:
STOCKHOLM, SWEDEN—This year’s Nobel Prize for economic sciences has been awarded to Angus Deaton, a microeconomist born in Edinburgh, Scotland.
The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences honoured Deaton, a professor of economics and international affairs at Princeton University, “for his analysis of consumption, poverty, and welfare.”
The Nobel committees have now announced all six of the annual US$975,000 awards.
